body_html:
@soumith @pavanky now I remember why I didn't use critical in another function: because that would generate an orphaned critical construct, which seems to be a mistake (see https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/4e60/37127e85445079272e1cb5574cbcce2e175e.pdf )

So, I'm more inclined to remove the parallel constructs altogether.
body_text:
@soumith @pavanky  now I remember why I didn't use critical in another function: because that would generate an orphaned critical construct, which seems to be a mistake (see https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/4e60/37127e85445079272e1cb5574cbcce2e175e.pdf )
So, I'm more inclined to remove the parallel constructs altogether.
body:
@soumith @pavanky  now I remember why I didn't use `critical` in another function: because that would generate an orphaned critical construct, which seems to be a mistake (see https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/4e60/37127e85445079272e1cb5574cbcce2e175e.pdf )

So, I'm more inclined to remove the `parallel` constructs altogether.
